metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0749 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in lib/Libdis/disrsi_.c in Terascale Open-Source Resource and Queue Manager (aka TORQUE Resource Manager) 2.5.x through 2.5.13 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a large count value. It was discovered that TORQUE Resource Manager has a stack-based buffer overflow. A remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtorque2 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-client - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-client-x11 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-common - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-mom - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-pam - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-scheduler - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
torque-server - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: torque package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16+dfsg-1.4ubuntu1').
